Others: The Brewers won both games of a doubleheader against the Reds with a score of 14-0 in the second game.
DL Hall pitched seven scoreless innings in the second game, which was his best performance in the Major Leagues so far.
The Brewers improved their record to 79-56, tying with the Phillies for the second-best record in the National League.
The Brewers have the best run differential (+133) in the Majors.
The temperature during the games peaked at 98 degrees and was still 90 degrees around when DL Hall threw his first pitch.
Bob Uecker, a former player for the Reds, shared his memories of playing in hot conditions at Crosley Field.
